author: ralexstokes
content:
we should define "traffic" and for the purpose of this answer, i'll say we mean "blobspace consumed at L1" ; i will also assume we are post-4844 and no rollup is using call data for data availability; in this case the low traffic rollup would use less data than the high traffic rollup

if traffic is used in a more general sense, or even for some L2 metric, then blobspace consumption is primarily a function of how well the rollup "compresses" to L1; e.g. i could drop a 1kb L2 transaction that has the effect in my L2 VM of doing a token swap and i can persist this entire 1kb object to a L1 blob; i could also be far more frugal w/ the blobspace and just record something 1 byte for token pair identifier, 40 bytes for each party to the trade, and say 8 bytes for the swap amount (so orders of magnitude less data at L1)

author: 0x6c
content: I'm reading this answer as saying that given equal compression techniques and equal traffic types, the L2 with "higher traffic" will consume linearly more blobspace at L1 post-4844 than the one with "lower traffic"

author: 0x6c
content: i.e. everything else being equal, performing 100 ERC-20 transfers on L2 costs twice as much L1-gas as performing 50 ERC-20 transfers

author: ralexstokes
content: if a rollup has 2x "traffic" then it would consume 2x data

author: ralexstokes
content: data in 4844 is priced separately from L1 gas

author: ralexstokes
content: so i don't think we can say 100 token transfers on L2 has any relation to L1 token transfers

author: 0x6c
content: understood. it can only be compared to the alternative L2

author: ralexstokes
content: if you take the L1 gas cost for calldata, you can get a gas/byte measure and use that to price data-gas

author: ralexstokes
content: but there is no formal relation and the markets fluctuate independently

author: 0x6c
content: since I already got you cornered here ðŸ˜„

author: 0x6c
content: is data-gas the proper term? does it increase/decrease by 12.5% similarly to ordinary gas depending on congestion?

author: 0x6c
content: ben's recent talk implied a 2 blob target, with 4 blob maximum, similar to the 15m gas target and 30m maximum
